meta.description: I participated as ITASD vice-coordinator in a Colibri-CRIC hybrid conference on impact-driven research and artificial intelligence, led by Prof. Samuel Fosso Wamba.

header.title: Seminar at Colibri-CRIC, Dschang
header.lead: On 17 February 2026, I participated in a hybrid Colibri-CRIC conference on impact-driven research and artificial intelligence, in person in Dschang, in my role as Vice-Coordinator of ITASD.

image.alt: Conference session at Colibri-CRIC in Dschang

data.text: On [b]Tuesday 17 February 2026[/b], the [b]Colibri Research and Innovation Center (CRIC)[/b] organized a special conference on [u]"Faire de la recherche a l'impact : focus sur l'intelligence artificielle"[/u], led by [b]Prof. Samuel Fosso Wamba[/b] (TBS Education, France; President of 237 DIASPROF). I attended in person in Dschang as [b]Vice-Coordinator of ITASD[/b].

rows: CRIC headquarters, Dschang (Menoua, West Region, Cameroon)
Prof. Samuel Fosso Wamba (Information Systems & Data Science, TBS Education; Vice-Dean for Research)
Research impact with a focus on artificial intelligence

data.legend: Opening discussion during the seminar at Colibri-CRIC (Dschang).

data.text: The in-person audience was composed mainly of [b]Master 1 and Master 2 students[/b], [b]doctoral students[/b], and [b]early-career researchers[/b] from social and exact sciences. The conference was opened by [b]Dr Boris Metsagho Mekontcho[/b], Executive Director of CRIC, and remained highly interactive with contributions and questions from both in-person and online participants.

items: [b]Opening note[/b]: the speaker was presented as the first researcher to offer a conference at CRIC on a major issue of our time, artificial intelligence.
[b]Interactive format[/b]: questions from participants were integrated throughout the session.
[b]Target audience relevance[/b]: the discussion was particularly useful for young researchers building their research positioning and methodology.
[b]Impact-oriented research is a dynamic cycle[/b]: research is not only knowledge accumulation, but a [i]problem - process - solution[/i] cycle that should connect with real actors and real needs.
[b]AI should be understood beyond buzzwords[/b]: the talk clarified what AI is, distinguished [b]weak AI[/b] and [b]strong AI[/b], and emphasized four capabilities (perceive, understand, act, learn).
[b]Societal impact remains under-researched[/b]: a major point was the imbalance between technical AI research and research on social impact ([b]about 97% technical vs 3% focused on social good[/b]).
[b]AI can support research work[/b]: summarization, hypothesis generation, and prototyping can accelerate research, but only with [u]ethics, rigor, critical thinking, and transparency[/u].

[b]Education and research must adapt intelligently[/b]: AI should be treated as a [i]partner[/i] for learning and research, not a crutch, with stronger emphasis on critical, creative, and relational competencies.
[b]Assessment redesign[/b]: when AI can draft large parts of a text, evaluation should place more weight on oral presentation, coordination, and critical reasoning.
[b]Publication ethics[/b]: the use of AI in research writing should be declared transparently when submitting to journals.

[b]Applied relevance[/b]: impact-driven research should intentionally address underexplored societal priorities (education, inclusion, crisis response, information verification, justice, public-sector management).

data.text: [color=#0d6adf][b]Colibri-CRIC[/b][/color] provides a strong environment for research dialogue and innovation-oriented exchange. [font=heading][b]ITASD[/b][/font] (Institute of Technology and Advanced Science for Sustainable Development), within the Colibri-CRIC ecosystem, aligns well with this perspective by connecting science, technology, and sustainable development concerns.

data.text: For my portfolio, this conference was an important milestone in strengthening an [b]impact-oriented perspective[/b] on research and on the responsible use of AI in academic work. A fuller recap (in French) is available on the Colibri-CRIC website: [Retour en images sur la conférence spéciale : « Faire de la recherche à l'impact : focus sur l'intelligence artificielle » animée par Samuel Fosso Wamba](https://colibri-cric.org/blog/2026/02/19/retour-en-images-sur-la-conference-speciale-faire-de-la-recherche-a-limpact-focus-sur-lintelligence-artificielle-animee-par-samuel-fosso-wamba/).
